question: What is Zeeman effect?
option1: splitting of spectral line in presence of magnetic field
option2: splitting of spectral line in presence of electric field
option3: convergence of spectral line in presence of magnetic field
option4: convergence of spectral line in presence of electric field
answer: splitting of spectral line in presence of magnetic field
explanation: Zeeman effect refers to the splitting of a spectrum line into several components by the application of a magnetic field. It is named after the Dutch physicist Pieter Zeeman.
